rComments: She was kool. Didn't have a big personality, but I like her. Some find lecture dry, but I thought the material was interesting so I was always engaged. And I felt that she was really trying to make class more engaging.Readings were repetitive, but in the end I had a great understanding of the course content. Not that hard to get an A in the class.

She kinda sucked as a lecturer honestly... but a pretty cool person. She just doesn't have much confidence.  Her lecturing was reeeaaalllly boring, and I honestly played solitaire most of the time, but the content of the class was interesting at least.
Really not a great lecturer. Slow, repetitive, boring. But the class is very easy.

DeGarmo was clearly a new teacher and terrible public speaker. I really looked forward to the TA taking over the lectures. The material was of the class was good, following much of Craig Haney's work. If you are going to take 147A/B, make sure it is with Professor Craig Haney.

Lecture can be boring, but if you go to class and do the reading, you will do well. Posts that say otherwise clearly didn't attend lecture or read. It's a very straight forward class and is easy to pass if you do the work. It enlightened my perspective on the U.S. legal justice system. Take it!

I throughly enjoyed taking psyc147. The course definitely changed my perspective on the legal system. The reading is heavy, but very interesting. There are two essays and two exams, which are very easy (100 true/false questions.)Â I can understand why some might be turned off by Erica's teaching style. Her lectures can be dry at times, and her speak

Erica was not as bad as the other posters were saying.  The class was pretty dry and boring, but It really did change the way I view our legal system, policies, and law enforcement.  This class completely overhauled my previous views (same goes with some friends who took the class with me).  It may be painful to sit through, but def. worth taking

A person who regurgitates other peoples ideas and cannot critically analyse or come up with her own unique ideas or thoughts. Spouts off large vocabulary to appear intelligent (key word is: appear). Learned too late that the class is all about the reading dont attend the lectures. Class is two essays and two mid-terms. good luck :)

She's not an effective teacher b/c her lectures are extremely boring and her slides plain.She just lists facts about socio-psych factors and never presents counterarguments or solutions.She's also uninspiring and not enthusiastic about teaching or hearing what her students have to say. Easy tests + essays, but a lot of reading.Section not mandatory

Her tests are extremely difficult to study for, there's no direction given for what to focus on, confusing presentation of material (she mumbles), and she's EXTREMELY BIASED towards the liberal perspective (so much so you really can't express in your papers any other perspective without being marked down for being "uneducated."AVOID PSYCH AND LAW!!

This was hands down, the worst class I have ever taken.  Ever.  She is condescending, totally unclear, her slides don't make any sense, her lectures are mind numbingly boring, she can't even answer the questions on her own midterm.  Simply put, she is a poor educator.  Don't take a class from her, you will regret it.

This was Erica's first class taught. She was nervous and a poor public speaker and simply recited her slides to us. 2 essays;Midterm/Final were 100 T/F and used a lot of the reading but were mostly trick questions (read them carefully!). Erica clearly knows her stuff but is probably better one-on-one than teaching a big class.
